results.title: Alaska: our pioneer heritage...
results.creator_credit: Pan American World Airways and Don Horter
results.brief_description: Discusses industries and the pattern of life in Alaska. The aeroplane has played an important part in the development of this rugged and sparsely-populated country by carrying supplies and goods from city to city and enabling posts in the outback to be established. Fishing is the largest industry, but lumbering and gold mining are important. Eskimos are employed in selling furs and artistic ornaments to tourists. Many visitors come to the country to hunt big game, fish and observe the beauties of snow and ice.

results.title: Alaska: land in the balance
results.brief_description: Features the mountains, lakes, rivers, glaciers, wildlife and native people of Alaska. Raises the question of how these natural resources are to be preserved.

results.title: Alaska: a modern frontier
results.brief_description: Alaska is not all snow, but a modern country with modern cities, housing and farming with a highway now linking it to the United States. This film shows of the progress made and comments on the progress still to come.

results.title: Alan Wake
results.brief_description: The story follows best-selling thriller novelist Alan Wake, as he tries to uncover the mystery behind his wife’s disappearance during a vacation in the small fictional town of Bright Falls, Washington, all while experiencing events from the plot in his latest novel, which he cannot remember writing, coming to life.

results.title: Alamo Bay
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Louis Malle and Vincent Malle
results.brief_description: French director Louis Malle seems to have an extraordinary gift to capture the spirit and ethos of American society. As in his earlier “Atlantic City”, this film features a great cast of accomplished actors who are offered the opportunity to develop richly complex characters. A young Vietnamese refugee attempts to find work in a Texas fishing town. His arrival is the catalyst for ugly confrontations between European and Asian Americans. Though the business owners are only too happy to exploit the labour of the refugee community, this creates tension between the Vietnamese and American workers who feel that their livelihood is threatened by immigrant labour. The film unflinchingly potrays the ugliness of racism but it does not resort to reducing people or events to stereotypes. By focusing on the experiences of Asian-Americans, “Alamo Bay” shows how the racist underpinnings of white Southern society affect all human relationships in the country. The outstanding cast includes Ed Harris, Amy Madigan and newcomer Ho Nguyen. The evocative theme music is by Ry Cooder.

results.title: Aladin et la Lampe Merveilleuse
results.brief_description:
A magician, famous for his tricks, is conjuring all the genies in order to find the marvellous lamp and become master of the world.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Gautreau ; director, Jean Image ; writers, France and Jean Image ; photography, Per Olaf Csongova ; music, Fred Freed.
Cast: Gaston Guez, Henri Virlojeux, Claire Guibert, Rene Hieronimus, Lucie Dolene, Fred Pasquali [voices only].

results.title: Aladdin and the magic lamp
results.creator_credit: lottie Reiniger Silhouette Films and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: An extract from Lotte Reineger’s first major silhouette film, Prince Achmet, which had a great success among the avant-garde film movement when it was first released in Paris and Britain. This portion recounts the Arabian nights story of Aladdin. No other credits available.

results.title: Aladdin
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Soar away on a magic carpet ride of non-stop enchantment in the most spectacular animated adventure of all time. Outrageously funny, furiously fast-paced and packed with dazzling surprises this film won two Academy Awards for Best Song (‘A Whole new world’) and for Best Score. Follow the fantastic story of Aladdin, a street-smart peasant boy who, with one rub of a magic lamp, meets up with the most hip, hilarious, totally unpredictable Genie the screen has ever seen. But the evil sorcerer, Jafar, also craves the lamp’s power. If Aladdin is to defeat him and win the love of the free spirited Jasmine, he must learn to be himself - and that’s one wish the Genie can’t grant! Now enjoy the breathtaking Disney artistry and phenomenal fun. Robin Williams is hilarious as the voice of the Genie. Voices also include Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin, Jonathan Freeman, Frank Welker.

results.title: Al Maguire
results.brief_description: Head coach Al Maguire has made Marquette University’s Warriors one of the most potent forces in college basketball. Maguire sees fear as motivating his own success and that of many others- fear of returning to some unsatisfactory situation one has been in- fear of losing the rewards of the present to some unknown situation.

results.title: Akira. Akira: production report
results.brief_description: This two volume collector’s edition contains the film itself and a 49 minute long report on the making of “Akira” featuring interviews with the director, the techniques he used and character profiles. “Akira” is set in 2019 in the city of Neo-Tokyo which is about to explode. A group of motorcycle-riding teenagers living in Neo-Tokyo tries to stop one of the gang who has run amok after becoming empowered with telekinetic powers in a government experiment. Technically spectacular, with colourful animation “Akira” is a must see for adult animation buffs.
